Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice with trace of handle root; white slip; interior glazed black; part of large elaborate rosette in added white outline with trace of added red centres; exterior (surface worn): female figure to right (part of red and black cloak with paired hook maeander border and dotted hem and black feet remaining); below, black band above trace of handle frill.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. For parallels regarding the exterior decoration, see British Musuem 1924,1201.410.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0833) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 51 (Other Accession Number)
